alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Chambers; Elmore; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:48PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Autauga, northwestern Lee, Elmore, north central Macon, southern Tallapoosa, southwestern Chambers and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 248 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Martin Dam to near Autaugaville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Montgomery, Auburn, Prattville, Opelika, Millbrook, Tuskegee, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Notasulga, Elmore, Coosada, Deatsville, Eclectic, Autaugaville, Waverly, Martin Dam, Santuck, Autauga County Airport, Dexter and Lagoon Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central, south central, southeastern and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Autauga; Chambers; Elmore; Lee; Macon; Montgomery; Tallapoosa
